The statement : "Zed has no bad matchups"

Means that Zed will win his lane 100% of the time no matter what

This is obviously NOT true for ANY character in league of legends


The statement: "Just because Zed HAS bad matchups doesn't make him balanced"

Means that Zed's bad matchups are because of champions who have kits that SPECIFICALLY target his abilities

Zed's bad matchups are explained better by the example below:

{{champion:238}} : _**"I USE SUPER MEGA DEATH- X MARK LAZER DESTROYER NUKE"**_

{{champion:122}} : "I use a pull, lol u ded"

{{champion:14}} : "wait you ulted me?"

{{champion:86}} : "JUSTICE  WILL CUT THROUGH YOUR SUPER MEGA DEATH-X MARK LAZER DESTROYER NUKE"

See the similarity in those champs?

They all can easily deal with Zed's burst while giving him a hard time if Zed ever jumps on them

They COUNTER any champ that _WANTS TO JUMP ON ENEMIES_

Zed is a champ that _WANTS TO JUMP ON ENEMIES_

Mages are vulnerable to being jumped on, so Zed DOMINATES even harder against mages because he can waveclear faster than then

There are reasons why the boards don't balance the game and viewpoints like these are the reason.

you CLEARLY are out of arguments if you are relying on deceiving others to attempt to win an argument

Zed is an assassin.

Assassins rely on kills to spike a gold lead to further push their advantage.

As such, assassins play aggressive, look for flashy plays/ganks or flanks to pick up a lead and carry on.

If you play malphite into zed, you don't allow him to leave his turret, as you can push and out-trade him at any point of the game, if you play 2v2 with your jungler, chances are you win on your own, as long as you don't get caught yourself.

If you picked first, and didn't ban a champion you KNOW you'll suffer and cannot lane against . In this case - Zed - you rely on jungle pressure and trying to play 3v2 / 3v1 as support/jg/mid. /while your top laner/adc farm side lanes/

If you play a champion that cannot deal with Zed, and you don't ban Zed for yourself, what the hell do you expect to happen? You'll get your bottom handed to you, no questions asked if he's picked by a semi-competent player.

I'm trying to pick up Asol and play on my smurf to practice, to my **surprise** people pick akali or zed / talon / ekko / fizz and jump on me to prevent me roaming. So I as a smart individual, do not blindly first pick Asol anymore as I've learned my lesson,  also started asking people to allow me to pick a character for them so I can counter mid with Asol if possible, if not I'll pick something else.

You LITERALLY made a case for why Zed is somehow balanced by saying "if you didn't counterpick him you deserve to lose"

WTF IS THAT KIND OF LOGIC?

"If you didn't counterpick Mundo you deserve to lose"

"if you counterpick Yorick you deserve to lose"

"If you didn't counterpick Draven you deserve to lose"

That's worse balancing logic than a generation 1 neural-network, AND EVEN THAT WOULD BE BALANCING A GAME WITH MORE LOGIC than his half-assed logic that you use

If you get counterpicked you ARE GOING TO "lose" the lane [which implies jungle control and possible free roams for him] and hope to stay on even terms for when teamfights and objectives start after the laning phase.

Half-assed logic is what you're saying here. - You can go even if you, yourself are good, but winning is a whole different story.

Would you stand a chance with a P90 against a literal tank ? - You can hide from it and "go even", but if you engage you'll get blown to bits.

According to Riot, Zed is meant to be good against mostly ADCs and only meant to go even in(and having a slightly weak) lane while not being able to waveclear as fast as most mages


If that is how Riot intended to balance Zed, then when he strays from this niche it means one of two things:

Either Zed is overpowered and is over-performing in one of the tasks mentioned above

OR

Zed is doing better at a different job than was initially intended for him


Zed isn't taking any other Champ's main job and has generally stuck to the midlane for the most part


This leaves one other option, Zed is overpowered and is over-performing in his mentioned tasks

What does Zed over-perform at?

Waveclear, Resource sustain, and in-lane damage

HMMMM Zed over-performs at tasks which are supposed to be his weakness...

I WONDER WHY I CALL HIM OVERPOWERED!!!
----------------------------------

Also I should mention that realistically speaking, someone armed with a P90 against any JJ-Abrams tank would be able to sneak up on the tank in a 1v1, open the top hatch and fire down on the pilots under most circumstances. If the tank VS the person with the P90 are in almost ANY situation, the person with the P90 wins because the Tank either: won't last long due to harsh weather/ground, won't be able to run without running out of gas for long(arctic or harsh deserts), the tank won't be able to go on harsh mountainous regions and is unable to turn as fast as the person which leaves for out-maneuverability to the person with the P90 

EVEN YOUR ANALOGY IS POORLY THOUGHT OUT!!!

Please, stop. You're arguments are devolving into of "Zed doesn't always win lane so he doesn't count as OP"
